## CloudDurableTestRunner.getOperationByIndex() method

Gets an operation by its execution order index.

Operations are indexed in the order they were executed, starting from 0. This method is useful when you know the execution order of operations.

**Signature:**

```typescript
getOperationByIndex<TOperationResult = any>(index: number): DurableOperation<TOperationResult>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

index

</td><td>

number

</td><td>

The zero-based index of the operation in execution order

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[DurableOperation](./durable-execution-sdk-js-testing.durableoperation.md)<!-- -->&lt;TOperationResult&gt;

An operation instance for the operation at the specified index

## Example

```typescript
// Get the first operation that was executed
const firstOp = runner.getOperationByIndex<number>(0);
await firstOp.waitForData();
```
